thread.title: Millburn High School field hockey team reaches Essex County tourney semifinals
thread.title_full: Millburn High School field hockey team reaches Essex County tourney semifinals

title: Millburn High School field hockey team reaches Essex County tourney semifinals
text:
Millburn High School field hockey team reaches Essex County tourney semifinals October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 2:11 PM By Jim Connelly Buy this photo staff photo by jim connelly 
Forward Victoria Jordan scored her second goal of the match with six minutes remaining in regulation Oct. 7, giving the sixth-seeded Millburn High School varsity field hockey team a come-from-behind 3-2 win over third-seeded Glen Ridge High School in the Essex County Tournament quarterfinals in Glen Ridge. 
Millburn (8-3-1) advances to face second-seeded Montclair High School in the county semifinals Saturday, Oct. 10, at 10 a.m. at Watchung Field in Montclair. 
Maggie Smith of Glen Ridge (5-5-1) scored twice in the first half, 10 minutes into the match and with a minute to go. 
Jordan scored three minutes after Smith's first goal. Fellow forward Lily Mynott assisted on the goal. 
Millburn pulled even for the second time when forward Lauren Dresner tapped in a pass from Mynott 10 minutes into the second half. 
Jordan scored the winning goal off a pass from midfielder Melissa Gula on an offensive corner. 
Miller goalie Emily Blumstein recorded eight saves. 
"It was a very 50/50 game," Miller head coach Sarah Pallino said. 
"We both had similar shots on goal as well as the same amount of corners. We just took advantage of one of the last offensive opportunities of the game. We played very well together yesterday." 
Millburn, by a quirk in the schedule, will now play back-to-back matches against Montclair. 
The teams are scheduled to meet in an Essex-Union Field Hockey Conference match today, Oct. 8, at 4 p.m. at Millburn High School's Miller Field. 
"The competition gets tougher as we move higher into the bracket," Pallino said. 
"Saturday's game will be tough. Montclair has fast aggressive players who are always skilled. I am confident that this will be the year we will beat them. Playing them today will be an advantage that we will see how they work together, but a disadvantage that they will be able to do the same." 
The Millers carry a 5-0-1 unbeaten streak into today's match against the 8-2 Mounties.
